actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with dominant military, economic, technological, and cultural influence. Controls global financial systems, leads innovation, and shapes international policy.

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core executive branch led by POTUS, directs federal government, shapes foreign/domestic policy, commands military, leads national security decisions, and exercises broad executive powers through orders and administrative actions

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading defense contractor and aerospace company providing advanced technology systems, military aircraft, missile defense systems, and cybersecurity solutions to the Executive Branch and Department of Defense. Major influence on defense policy, national security decisions, and military procurement.

sub_actors.name: Palantir Technologies
sub_actors.description: Data analytics and software company providing critical intelligence and decision-making platforms to executive agencies, including counterterrorism operations, intelligence analysis, and pandemic response. Strong influence on federal data strategy and national security technology.

sub_actors.name: Amazon Web Services
sub_actors.description: Leading cloud computing provider handling classified and unclassified government data infrastructure, including CIA cloud services and numerous executive agency operations. Significant influence on federal IT modernization and digital transformation initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central bank controlling monetary policy, interest rates, and financial stability. Regulates banking system, manages currency, and has enormous influence over US and global economy through monetary decisions

sub_actors.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
sub_actors.description: Largest U.S. bank by assets, primary dealer of U.S. Treasury securities, major participant in Federal Reserve operations, and significant influence on monetary policy implementation. Key player in Fed's payment systems and financial services.

sub_actors.name: BlackRock, Inc.
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset manager, crucial Fed partner during financial crises, advisor on bond-buying programs, and major influence on market operations. Provides critical market intelligence and implementation support for Fed policies.

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs Group
sub_actors.description: Premier investment bank and primary dealer, significant role in Fed's market operations, major participant in monetary policy transmission, and key provider of financial market expertise to the Federal Reserve System.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Controls world's most powerful military, manages largest budget, directs global military operations, oversees nuclear arsenal, and shapes international security policy through military presence and capabilities

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor specializing in aerospace, military weapons systems, and advanced technologies. Primary supplier of F-35 fighter jets and missile systems. Largest defense contractor by revenue with extensive DoD contracts.

sub_actors.name: Raytheon Technologies
sub_actors.description: Major aerospace and defense company providing advanced systems in missiles, aircraft engines, and cybersecurity. Key supplier of radar systems, guided missiles, and military electronics with significant Pentagon contracts.

sub_actors.name: Boeing Defense, Space & Security
sub_actors.description: Leading manufacturer of military aircraft, satellites, missile systems, and space technology. Producer of iconic platforms like F-15, Apache helicopters, and KC-46 tankers. Critical defense industrial base partner.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: Rising superpower with world's largest population, second-largest economy, growing military power, and expanding global infrastructure initiatives like Belt and Road.

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: The ruling political party that controls all aspects of governance, sets national policy, manages personnel appointments across state institutions, and maintains absolute leadership over state, military and society

sub_actors.name: Sinopec Group
sub_actors.description: China's largest oil and gas company, a state-owned enterprise that dominates the nation's petroleum and petrochemical industries. Controls crucial energy infrastructure and supply chains while implementing CCP's energy policies.

sub_actors.name: China State Construction Engineering Corporation
sub_actors.description: World's largest construction company and state-owned enterprise, responsible for major infrastructure projects domestically and internationally as part of Belt and Road Initiative.

sub_actors.name: Huawei Technologies
sub_actors.description: Global telecommunications giant and technology leader in 5G, smartphones, and network equipment. Though privately owned, maintains strong ties to CCP and is crucial to China's technological advancement goals.

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission (CMC)
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command body that controls the People's Liberation Army, sets defense policy, and oversees military modernization and strategy. Reports directly to CCP leadership

sub_actors.name: China North Industries Group Corporation (Norinco)
sub_actors.description: State-owned defense corporation and China's largest arms manufacturer, producing military equipment, vehicles, and weapons systems. Key supplier to PLA and major defense exporter internationally.

sub_actors.name: Aviation Industry Corporation of China (AVIC)
sub_actors.description: State-owned aerospace and defense conglomerate developing military aircraft, avionics, and defense systems. Primary supplier of aircraft to PLA Air Force and key player in military modernization.

sub_actors.name: China Electronics Technology Group Corporation (CETC)
sub_actors.description: State-owned enterprise specializing in electronic and information technology systems for military use, including radar, communications, and cybersecurity solutions.

sub_actors.name: State Council
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative authority of China, serves as the executive branch, manages state bureaucracy, implements national policies, and oversees economic planning and regulation

sub_actors.name: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC)
sub_actors.description: China's largest state-owned oil and gas corporation, controlling majority of domestic petroleum resources and operations. Critical to national energy security and economic development, with extensive international operations and strategic partnerships.

sub_actors.name: State Grid Corporation of China
sub_actors.description: World's largest utility company, monopolizing China's power distribution and transmission. Controls national electricity infrastructure and drives energy policy implementation across most provinces.

sub_actors.name: China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC)
sub_actors.description: Largest construction and real estate conglomerate in China, leading infrastructure development domestically and internationally. Key executor of national construction projects and Belt and Road Initiative.

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic and political alliance of 27 states, representing significant trade bloc, regulatory influence, and diplomatic power.

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU, responsible for proposing legislation, implementing decisions, upholding treaties, and managing day-to-day business. Holds significant power in policy initiation and enforcement.

sub_actors.name: Airbus SE
sub_actors.description: Major European multinational aerospace corporation, leading manufacturer of commercial aircraft, defense systems, and space technology. Key strategic partner in EU aviation and defense initiatives, employing over 130,000 people across Europe.

sub_actors.name: TotalEnergies SE
sub_actors.description: French multinational integrated energy company, major player in EU energy policy and transition, significant influence on European climate and energy regulations, operates in over 130 countries.

sub_actors.name: Deutsche Bank AG
sub_actors.description: Germany's largest banking institution, crucial player in EU financial markets, significant influence on European monetary policy and financial regulations, major provider of corporate and investment banking services.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Controls EU monetary policy, manages the euro, and supervises banking system. Has tremendous influence over Eurozone economic policy and financial stability.

sub_actors.name: Deutsche Bank AG
sub_actors.description: Germany's largest bank and one of Europe's most systemically important financial institutions. Key ECB monetary policy transmission channel and major participant in ECB operations. Significant influence on Eurozone financial markets.

sub_actors.name: BNP Paribas
sub_actors.description: Largest bank in the Eurozone by assets. Critical partner in ECB's monetary operations and major provider of financial services across EU. Key player in implementing ECB policies and financial stability measures.

sub_actors.name: Clearstream Banking S.A.
sub_actors.description: Leading European post-trade services provider and securities depository. Critical infrastructure provider for ECB operations and Euro-denominated securities settlement. Essential for ECB monetary policy implementation.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected legislative body that passes EU laws jointly with Council, approves EU budget, and provides democratic oversight. Key institution in EU decision-making process.

sub_actors.name: TotalEnergies SE
sub_actors.description: Major French multinational energy corporation with significant lobbying influence on EU energy policy, climate regulations, and infrastructure projects. Key player in European energy security discussions and green transition initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Volkswagen Group
sub_actors.description: Leading European automotive manufacturer heavily involved in EU industrial policy, emissions standards, and electric vehicle legislation. Major employer and influential voice in trade, manufacturing, and environmental regulations.

sub_actors.name: Deutsche Bank AG
sub_actors.description: Prominent financial institution with substantial influence on EU financial regulations, banking policies, and economic decisions. Key stakeholder in European financial markets and banking union discussions.

actors.name: Big Tech Consortium (Meta, Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon)
actors.description: Collective tech giants controlling global digital infrastructure, data, AI development, and online platforms that shape modern society.

sub_actors.name: Industry Standards Coalition
sub_actors.description: Joint technical standards body comprising representatives from major tech companies that establishes protocols, interoperability standards, and development frameworks that become de facto global digital infrastructure standards
sub_actors.parent_actor: Big Tech Consortium (Meta, Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon)

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Global technology leader with significant influence in setting industry standards for operating systems, cloud computing, and enterprise software. Major contributor to web standards, programming frameworks, and cloud infrastructure protocols.

sub_actors.name: Apple Inc.
sub_actors.description: Influential tech company that shapes mobile technology standards, app development frameworks, and hardware interface protocols. Their decisions on support for technologies often determine industry-wide adoption.

sub_actors.name: Google LLC
sub_actors.description: Leading force in web standards, browser technologies, and mobile platforms. Major influence on internet protocols, web development standards, and AI frameworks through active participation in standards bodies.

sub_actors.name: Digital Policy Council
sub_actors.description: Cross-company executive committee that coordinates shared policy positions, lobbying efforts, and strategic responses to regulatory challenges across global markets
sub_actors.parent_actor: Big Tech Consortium (Meta, Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon)

sub_actors.name: Meta Platforms, Inc.
sub_actors.description: Leading social media conglomerate and key digital policy influencer, actively shapes regulatory frameworks for data privacy, content moderation, and digital market competition through significant policy advocacy and industry coordination

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Major technology company with substantial influence in cloud computing, enterprise software, and AI policy development, particularly active in cybersecurity standards and digital infrastructure regulation

sub_actors.name: Alphabet Inc.
sub_actors.description: Tech giant with dominant market position in search, digital advertising, and emerging technologies, exercises significant influence over internet policy, data protection standards, and AI governance frameworks

sub_actors.name: AI Ethics Board
sub_actors.description: Joint oversight body responsible for establishing ethical guidelines, safety protocols, and governance frameworks for artificial intelligence development across member companies
sub_actors.parent_actor: Big Tech Consortium (Meta, Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon)

sub_actors.name: DeepMind Technologies
sub_actors.description: Leading AI research company and pioneer in ethical AI development, heavily influences AI safety standards and governance frameworks through research publications and technical implementations

sub_actors.name: OpenAI
sub_actors.description: Major AI research organization developing large language models and advocating for responsible AI development, significantly shapes ethical guidelines and safety protocols

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Research
sub_actors.description: Corporate research division leading ethical AI initiatives and implementing governance frameworks across enterprise AI applications, major contributor to AI safety standards

actors.name: Federal Reserve System
actors.description: US central bank with enormous influence over global financial markets, monetary policy, and international economic stability.

sub_actors.name: Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC)
sub_actors.description: Principal monetary policymaking body of the Federal Reserve that sets key interest rates, manages open market operations, and directs U.S. monetary policy implementation

sub_actors.name: BlackRock Inc.
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset management firm with significant influence on monetary policy through its massive holdings of Treasury securities and regular consultation with the Fed on market operations

sub_actors.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
sub_actors.description: Largest U.S. bank and primary dealer in U.S. Treasury securities, providing crucial market intelligence and execution services for FOMC operations

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs Group
sub_actors.description: Leading investment bank and primary dealer that plays a key role in implementing FOMC monetary policy decisions and providing market analysis

sub_actors.name: Board of Governors
sub_actors.description: Seven-member governing board that guides overall Fed policy, sets bank regulations, and oversees the 12 Federal Reserve Banks, appointed by the President and confirmed by Senate

sub_actors.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
sub_actors.description: Largest U.S. bank by assets, significant participant in Federal Reserve operations, major primary dealer of U.S. Treasury securities, and key stakeholder in Fed policy implementation

sub_actors.name: BlackRock Financial Management
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset manager, selected by Fed for managing bond-buying programs, crucial advisor on market operations and monetary policy implementation

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs Group
sub_actors.description: Leading global investment bank, primary dealer of U.S. government securities, significant influence on monetary policy through market operations and research

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
sub_actors.description: Most influential of the 12 Reserve Banks, implements monetary policy through market operations, supervises major financial institutions, and manages international relations

sub_actors.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
sub_actors.description: Largest U.S. bank and key primary dealer in Fed operations, heavily involved in monetary policy implementation and securities transactions with the NY Fed, major participant in Federal funds market
sub_actors.parent_actor: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs Group
sub_actors.description: Premier investment bank and primary dealer, crucial role in Fed's market operations, significant influence in financial markets and monetary policy transmission, key participant in Fed's regulatory discussions
sub_actors.parent_actor: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

sub_actors.name: Citigroup Inc.
sub_actors.description: Global financial services corporation, major primary dealer, essential partner in international dollar clearing operations, significant participant in Fed's market operations and regulatory framework
sub_actors.parent_actor: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
